hypothesis_content.title: Intraday Momentum Fade on Failed 1-Hour Volume Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: A sharp 1-hour price spike (>2.5%) on low relative volume (< 80% of its 20-period average) during a NEUTRAL regime will fail to sustain momentum and revert within the next 3-5 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a directionless (NEUTRAL) market, large moves require volume conviction. A low-volume spike is likely a liquidity grab or stop-run, not a sustainable trend initiation, creating a high-probability fade opportunity as the market absorbs the illiquid move.
entry_conditions: Any 1H candle shows a range (High-Low) > 2.5% of the candle's open.
That same 1H candle's volume < 0.8 * its 20-period volume SMA.
Enter on the open of the following 1H candle.

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the spike candle's range.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price exceeds the high of the spike candle.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Falsified if the mean reversion to the 50% retracement level occurs in less than 60% of cases, or if the stop-loss is hit more than 35% of the time.
